page.title: 14Keeping Racing Pigeons.
page.content: Both our dads keep racing pigeons. They keep the pigeons in sheds at the bottom of the garden. We both have over 50 birds. All the family help look after them. We feed them corn and clean them out every day and each day they are allowed to fly free. When they are being trained the birds are taken away from home and released. If they come back, this is then repeated over longer distances. In a race birds are put in a basket and sent off in vans with other peoples pigeons. They are released together. When they get home a ring on their leg is stamped by a special clock. The fastest time wins. The winner of races usually wins money.
